turn.1: What band did the duo Software work with?
turn.2: Software (band)  Software was a German electronic duo active between 1984 and 2000, comprising (born 1951) and (born 1948).
turn.3: What was something interesting about the duo?
turn.4: Formerly the duo used the name Mergener&Weisser.
turn.5: Did the duo work with any other bands?
turn.6: The group released their records under the IC () label, which also released a number of other electronic musicians, including Klaus Schulze and the Neue Deutsche Welle group Ideal.
turn.7: Did the duo release any albums?
turn.8: From 1990 to 1992 Weisser produced, during a temporary break with Mergener, four albums under the Software name with a different group composition: "Fragrance" with Klaus Schulze and Georg Stettner (born 1970), and "Modesty-Blaze I" / "II" and "Cave" with Billy Byte (Stephan Töteberg).
turn.9: Did the duo ever break up?
turn.10: After the dissolution of Software in 1999, the two musicians went their separate ways: Peter Mergener continues to compose and play electronic music, while Michael Weisser first founded the group G.E.N.E. (Grooving Electronic Natural Environments), and is currently, among other things, active as a media artist.
